items.title: ‘Catastrophic’ Hurricane Hits Jamaica as Risk of Climate Change-Fueled Tropical Storms Rises
bullets: • Melissa, a Category 5 hurricane with winds exceeding 180 miles per hour, made landfall midday Tuesday in Jamaica
• The hurricane hit the island as research shows climate change magnifying the destructive force of tropical cyclones
• The likelihood of a tropical cyclone becoming a major hurricane increased by 5 percent per decade from 1979 to 2017

items.title: SNAP cutoff could hurt Texas grocers and the rest of the economy, experts say
bullets: • The cutoff of benefits to 3.5 million Texans that depend on the program could have ripple effects beyond those directly affected
• Those who rely on SNAP to buy groceries for themselves and their families make up about 12% of all grocery sales nationwide
• Experts say the sudden loss of that income will mean SNAP recipients have less money to spend in Texas grocery stores

items.title: OpenAI data suggests 1 million users discuss suicide with ChatGPT weekly
bullets: • 0.15 percent of ChatGPT’s active users in a given week have conversations that include explicit indicators of potential suicidal planning or intent
• With more than 800 million weekly active users, that translates to over a million people each week
• Hundreds of thousands of people show signs of psychosis or mania in their weekly conversations with the chatbot
• The first time in history large numbers of people have begun to confide their feelings to a talking machine

• He was raised by his mother and father
• He sang doo-wop and played in dance bands
• He played with Thelonious Monk and Art Blakey
• He died at age 83

items.title: Two crucial Florida coral species left ‘functionally extinct’ by ocean heatwave
bullets: • Two of the most important coral species that made up Florida’s reef are now functionally extinct after a withering ocean heatwave caused catastrophic losses
• The “functional extinction” is a stage before global extinction, a threat that now looms for many coral species
• Scientists this month warned that a tipping point had been reached whereby corals around the world are set to be wiped out
